location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No 997 of 1823 from William Newnham, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay to Captain John Macleod, Resident in the Gulph of Persia [Persian Gulf]

mods.abstract: The letter explains that the General Maritime Treaty does not prohibit the Arab tribes in the Persian Gulf from rebuilding their forts, but notes that the Resident should report any such activity back to the Bombay Government.
